page.title: 01SHIPSTON AND HONINGTON
page.content: This area is drained by the River Stour flowing north to join the Avon. { Shipston-on-Stour}is the dominant settlement,being along the west bank of the river.Deriving its name and 18th century prosperity from the wool trade,it was once an important market town.Much of the town is affected by the heavy north-south traffic of A34 from Birmingham to Oxford.The town has grown considerably recently.400 new houses have triggered a population rise from 2100 to 3550 in 10 years The town is outgrowing its attractive Georgian centre as far as shopping and car-parking are concerned. North-east of Shipston lies{Honington with a population of about 120.This pretty village is dominated by Honington Hall (17th c). Thinly populated farmland,mainly arable,surrounds these settlements.
